CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 11, 1957, pg. 14 reads: "Pulpit Guest At Bethel AME - A near capacity audience attended the gala anniversary service of Bethel AME Church, May 5 when Major L.A. Cousin, U.S. Army chaplain, brought the anniversary sermon.  Program included the following, who are seated, left to right: the Revs. James White, assistant pastor; O.M. Walton, Council of Churches; Major Cousin, Dr. Lester W. Bumpus, the Rev. C.S. Spivey Jr., pastor, and the Rev. H. R .Tolliver, pastor, Grace Presbyterian Church.  Bethel is the oldest Negro congregation in Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated, from left: Rev. James White, Rev. O.M. Walton, Major L.A. Cousin, Dr. Lester W. Bumpus, Rev. C.S. Spivey Jr., and Rev. H. R .Tolliver in Bethel AME Church for anniversary services
